title: Workshop Tools Quiz
description: How well do you know your way around a workshop? Identify common hand tools and workshop equipment.

questions.question: Which workshop tool has two adjustable jaws mounted on a bench, used to hold objects firmly in place?
What is a ball-peen hammer typically used for?
Which tool is an L-shaped hexagonal wrench used to turn bolts and screws with hexagonal sockets?
What is a try square used for in woodworking?
Which hand tool has a hardened steel blade used to cut grooves and shape wood by paring?
What is a hand plane used for?
options: Smoothing and flattening wood surfaces by shaving thin layers

questions.question: Which tool has a handle attached to a heavy metal head and a claw for removing nails?
What is a marking gauge used for?
options: Scribing a line parallel to an edge on a piece of wood

questions.question: Which workshop tool is a long, narrow saw with fine teeth, used for precise cuts in woodworking joints?
What is a center punch used for?
options: Making a small indentation to guide a drill bit

questions.question: Which tool resembles a file but has larger, individual teeth for rapidly removing material from wood?
What is a speed square (rafter square) used for?
options: Marking angles and making quick 90 and 45-degree lines

questions.question: Which clamp has a C-shaped frame with a threaded screw for clamping objects together?
What is a tap and die set used for?
options: Creating and repairing screw threads in metal

questions.question: Which measuring tool uses a bubble in liquid to determine if a surface is perfectly horizontal?
